Private Attributes

VideoStoreProxy * mpVideoStoreProxy

Detailed Description

Video content provider.

The Video provider contains meta data for all available video on both internal and external storage devices.

The following example demonstrates how to use this VideoStore class.

 addvideo() {
     // Add a video
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     VideoStore* videoStore = new VideoStore(*context);
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();

     cv->addValue(VideoStore::DATA(), filePath);
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::TITLE(), videoName);
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::DISPLAY_NAME(), videoName);
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::DESCRIPTION(), description);
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::DATE_TAKEN(), dateTaken);
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::MIME_TYPE(), mimeType);

     videoStore->add(VideoStore::VIDEO_URI(VideoStore::INTERNAL), *cv);

     delete context;
     delete videoStore;
     delete cv;
 }

 showEditAndDeleteVideo() {
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     VideoStore* videoStore = new VideoStore(*context);
     StringArray selection(3);
     selection.replaceAt(VideoStore::ID(), 0);
     selection.replaceAt(VideoStore::DATA(), 1);
     selection.replaceAt(VideoStore::DESCRIPTION(), 2);

     // Show videos
     Cursor* videos = videoStore->getN(VideoStore::VIDEO_URI(VideoStore::INTERNAL),
         &selection, NULL, NULL, &VideoStore::VIDEO_ORDER());

     if (videos != NULL && videos->getCount() > 0) {
         videos->moveToFirst();
         do {
             int64_t id = videos->getLong(0);
             String data = videos->getString(1);
             String description = videos->getString(2);

             // ...
         } while (videos->moveToNext());
     }
     // Close the cursor
     videos->close();

     // Edit a video
     ContentValues* cv = new ContentValues();
     cv->addValue(VideoStore::DESCRIPTION(), newDescription);

     Uri uri1 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(VideoStore::VIDEO_URI(VideoStore::INTERNAL), updateId);
     videoStore->set(uri1, *cv, NULL, NULL);

     // Delete a video
     Uri uri2 = ContentUris::withAppendedId(VideoStore::VIDEO_URI(VideoStore::INTERNAL), deleteId);
     videoStore->remove(uri2, NULL, NULL);

     delete context;
     delete videoStore;
     delete cv;
 }

See the sample given above. There are four operations about VideoStore: add, edit, show and remove.

enum gaia::content::VideoStore::StorageType

Storage Type.

Enumerator:
INTERNAL 

The internal storage.

static base::String gaia::content::VideoStore::ALBUM ( ) [static]

Type: TEXT

The artist who created the video file, if any.

Type: TEXT

static base::String gaia::content::VideoStore::BOOKMARK ( ) [static]

The bookmark for the video.

Time in ms. Represents the location in the video that the video should start playing at the next time it is opened. If the value is null or out of the range 0..DURATION-1 then the video should start playing from the beginning.

Type: INTEGER

static base::String gaia::content::VideoStore::BUCKET_DISPLAY_NAME ( ) [static]

The bucket display name of the video.

This is a read-only property that is automatically computed from the DATA column.

Type: TEXT

static base::String gaia::content::VideoStore::BUCKET_ID ( ) [static]

The bucket id of the video.

This is a read-only property that is automatically computed from the DATA column.

Type: TEXT

void gaia::content::VideoStore::cancelThumbnailRequest ( int64_t  origId)

This method cancels the thumbnail request so clients waiting for getThumbnail will be interrupted and return immediately.

Only the original process which made the getThumbnail requests can cancel their own requests.

Parameters:
origIdoriginal video id

static base::String gaia::content::VideoStore::DATE_MODIFIED ( ) [static]

The time the file was last modified.

Units are seconds since 1970. NOTE: This is for internal use by the media scanner. Do not modify this field.

Type: INTEGER (int64_t)

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::VideoStore::getN ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Query the given table, returning a Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing null will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing null will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

graphics::Bitmap* gaia::content::VideoStore::getThumbnailN ( int64_t  origId,
int32_t  kind,
const graphics::BitmapFactory::Options &  options 
)

This method checks if the thumbnails of the specified image (origId) has been created.

It will be blocked until the thumbnails are generated.

Parameters:
origIdOriginal image id associated with thumbnail of interest.
kindThe type of thumbnail to fetch. Should be either MINI_KIND = 1 or MICRO_KIND = 3.
optionsThis is only used for MINI_KIND when decoding the Bitmap.
Returns:
A Bitmap instance. It could be null if the original image associated with origId doesn't exist or memory is not enough.

The caller should delete the returned object to release the allocated memory when the object is not used anymore.

int32_t gaia::content::VideoStore::remove ( const net::Uri &  uri,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
